intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: Rain makes the street look cleaner than it is. Neon lies in puddles like spilled confession.

intro.speaker: NARRATOR
intro.text: Vivian said she’d be under the light. People always choose light when they’re scared of what’s in the dark.

vivian_intro.speaker: VIVIAN
vivian_intro.text: My sister Eleanor is dead. Avalon Hotel. Room 214. The police wrote ‘suicide’ like it was a receipt.

vivian_intro.speaker: YOU
vivian_intro.text: Suicide cases don’t usually come with an extra zero.

vivian_intro.speaker: VIVIAN
vivian_intro.text: Eleanor was afraid. Last night she went to The Blue Moon. She said if anything happened… to find Mickey.

vivian_intro.speaker: YOU
vivian_intro.text: Then let’s start where the trouble drinks.

vivian_return.speaker: VIVIAN
vivian_return.text: Please… don’t let them bury her story with the body.

matchbook.speaker: NARRATOR
matchbook.text: A Blue Moon matchbook. Gold letters. Cheap paper.

matchbook.speaker: NARRATOR
matchbook.text: It smells like smoke, perfume, and a bad decision made twice.

door_bar_locked.speaker: NARRATOR
door_bar_locked.text: Going in blind is a good way to get corrected. I should talk to Vivian first.

bar_enter.speaker: NARRATOR
bar_enter.text: The Blue Moon isn’t blue. It’s bruised.

bar_enter.speaker: NARRATOR
bar_enter.text: Mickey’s behind the bar, polishing the same glass like he’s trying to erase a night.

mickey_intro.speaker: MICKEY
mickey_intro.text: She was here. Nervous. Kept watching the door like it owed her money.

mickey_intro.speaker: MICKEY
mickey_intro.text: Big guy came in. Gray suit. The kind of suit that says ‘lawyer’ but means ‘muscle.’ They argued.

mickey_intro.speaker: MICKEY
mickey_intro.text: No. But I heard trouble. And trouble usually brings friends.

mickey_return.speaker: MICKEY
mickey_return.text: If you’re smart, you’ll walk away. If you’re you… you won’t.

glass.speaker: NARRATOR
glass.text: Lipstick on the rim. Not fresh enough to be today. Not old enough to be forgiven.

glass.speaker: NARRATOR
glass.text: Eleanor sat here. And someone sat close enough to matter.

thug_enter.speaker: NARRATOR
thug_enter.text: The room shifts. The air goes thin.

thug_enter.speaker: NARRATOR
thug_enter.text: A man in a gray suit steps out of the shadows like he’s been there the whole time.

thug_enter.speaker: THUG
thug_enter.text: You’re asking the wrong questions, pal.

thug_down.speaker: NARRATOR
thug_down.text: He hits the floor hard enough to make the bottles flinch.

thug_down.speaker: YOU
thug_down.text: Tell your boss I’m not done yet.
